This document describes the required protocol to conduct insert name of the method/protocol.

Summary

Insert a short description of the background for the method/protocol (e.g. why and for which purpose do you perform water sampling).
Please provide a brief summary of your method including, as appropriate, a brief description of what techniques your best practice is about, which ocean environments or regions it targets, the primary sensors covered, what type of data/measurements/observing platform it covers, limits to its applicability.

Method description and rationale

Insert a short description of the functioning principal of the methodology used in the protocol (i.e. how does the method work?). Please note that this is different from the step-by-step description of the protocol procedure.
Insert a short statement explaining why the specific methodology used in the protocol has been selected (e.g. it is highly reproducible, highly accurate, procedures are easy to execute etc….).

Spatial coverage and environment(s) of relevance

If applicable, please specify the region where the protocol is applied. For regional term guidance see here. If applicable, please indicate here the environment(s) of relevance for the protocol, e.g. Abyssal plain. Select from the ENVO terminology.

Personnel Required

Insert the number of technicians, data managers, and scientists required for the good execution of the procedure

Safety

Identify hazards associated with the procedure and specify protective equipment and safety training required to safely execute the procedure

Training requirements

Specify technical training required for the good execution of the procedure.

Time needed to execute the procedure

Specify how much time is necessary to execute the procedure.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":106,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":557,"length":32},{"style":"bold","offset":1011,"length":48},{"style":"bold","offset":1311,"length":18},{"style":"bold","offset":1445,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":1595,"length":21},{"style":"bold","offset":1696,"length":36},{"style":"italic","offset":106,"length":7},{"style":"italic","offset":557,"length":32},{"style":"italic","offset":1011,"length":48},{"style":"italic","offset":1311,"length":18},{"style":"italic","offset":1445,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":1595,"length":21},{"style":"italic","offset":1696,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","10_0":"","10_1":"","11_0":"","11_1":"","12_0":"","12_1":"","13_0":"","13_1":"","14_0":"","14_1":"","15_0":"","15_1":"","16_0":"","16_1":"","17_0":"","17_1":"","18_0":"","18_1":"","19_0":"","19_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","20_0":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","5_0":"","5_1":"","6_0":"","6_1":"","7_0":"","7_1":"","8_0":"","8_1":"","9_0":"","9_1":""},"colTitles":["MIOP Term","Value"],"colWidths":[200,"399"],"data":[["methodology category","Environmental DNA - dual PCR illumina library preparation for the sequencing of cytochrme oxidase I gene."],["project","Hakai Genomics"],["purpose","Metazooan community and diversity assessment from environmental DNA."],["analyses","Polymerase chain reaction. steps.section: Purification of first PCR product using SPRI beads
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4locm","text":"Vortex the beads before use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d6d6f","text":"Add 16 μl beads to 20 μl of PCR product to obtain a ratio of 0.8.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cklgp","text":"Pipette up and down ten times (or until the solution is well mixed – you will see that the color changes).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6b86p","text":"Spin tubes down to remove drops from the walls.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Purification of first PCR product using SPRI beads
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cgrnm","text":"Incubate at room temperature without shaking for 5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"efvmi","text":"Then, place the plate on the magnetic stand until the supernatant has cleared (~ 3 min). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Purification of first PCR product using SPRI beads
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e05cu","text":"Remove the supernatant with a multichannel pipette, ensuring to not disturb the beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Purification of first PCR product using SPRI beads
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9a54u","text":"With the samples on the magnetic rack, wash the beads by adding 180 μl of freshly prepared 80% ethanol and incubate for 30s. Carefully remove the supernatant without disturbing the beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Purification of first PCR product using SPRI beads
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fcepb","text":"Repeat the washing step   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":24,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5qhtr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AA47641B7F9D455891A06DAB014695B4","step_guid":"FF1BA11866234340B1371440B4730F9B","title":""}}}}

steps.section: Purification of first PCR product using SPRI beads
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cvqnu","text":"Remove all residual ethanol using a pipette and air dry, leaving the samples on the magnetic stand (~ 5 min*). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7uhjr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9sm0r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8c3jb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1cn2p","text":"*This depends on the type of the magnetic rack – the O-ring magnet dries faster than the side magnet.  Keep an eye on the beads and do not over-dry. Otherwise, you will not get an efficient DNA recovery. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Purification of first PCR product using SPRI beads
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"22ad4","text":" Remove the plate from the magnetic stand and add 40 μl of nuclease-free water for elution. Gently pipet up and down ten times to resuspend the beads.  Incubate the plate at room temperature for 5 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Purification of first PCR product using SPRI beads
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cojo3","text":"Place the plate back on the magnetic rack for at least 5 min or until the supernatant is cleared.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Purification of first PCR product using SPRI beads
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"842ag","text":"Carefully transfer 30 μl of the clear supernatant to a new plate. Seal the plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eodmc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"545rb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ekd9","text":"Use a fluorometric quantification method that uses dsDNA dyes to measure the concentration of your libraries (Qubit or plate reader). If using Qubit, give preference to theBroad Range kit (BR) if you visualize a strong band in the gel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"851vc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ga47","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8hee6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bajs4","text":"Samples will have approximately similar concentrations (usually). Re-check samples that showed very high or low concentrations on Qubit/plate reader quantification.  ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8p3eg","text":"Run a subset of the PCR product (5μl) on a 1.5% agarose gel to check the size of the amplicons and the success of the amplification.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aduct","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9469t","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"36dqb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b73es","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bg93e","text":"If any additional bands appear that are not the size of the desired product, additional purification steps need to be carried out. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2pgh6","text":"Calculate sample volume to have a final amount of 10-40 ng. This amount may vary depending on the overall quantification. For example, if on average the concentration of your samples is about 3 ng/μl and you have 20 μl of product,  you can calculate the volume to make up to 60 ng per sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4i0f1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dm9gg","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9edi5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"afbsc","text":"Check the final volume that you will get after pooling – sometimes you will end up with 2 mL or more. Then use the proper Eppendorf tube for pooling (1.5, 2.0, or 5 mL). ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"10jpe","text":"Measure the final library pool concentration on Qubit using the High Sensitivity (HS) kit. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ha9j","text":"Label tube: [Gene_name], [Project_Name], Pooled Amplicons. Date, Initials, pool concentration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bqpu5","text":"Ensure that all reagents are aliquoted in appropriate amounts, and stored according to manufacturers' recommendations. Never pipet directly from reagent stocks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ht4t","text":"Prepare the SPRI beads' working solution, and test their efficiency following this protocol: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ab8sv","text":"Prepare primer working stocks (10μM) for both the first and second PCR steps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"37fd7","text":"We advise preparing the indexing primers according to this configuration:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ao912","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6jtv9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"","id":465425,"original_name":"Indexes_plate.xlsx","placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/extensions/xlsx.png","raw_source":"","size":39392,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qgstcbk77.xlsx"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c3fpn","text":"We advise adding aliquots of the extracted DNA to a 96-Well PCR plate to facilitate the setup of the PCR reaction. This metadata template will help keep track of the samples, and if indexes are configured as described above, also the identity of sample indexes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
